text: Bomber from Ladyface. Nose of thin stone fruit, gently tart, with a bit of oak barrel. Deep amber color, creamy white head. Lightly tart fruit, somewhat acidic, a bit of citrus, cream cheese, and a thin tart finish. Thin-medium body. Smooth and pleasant.
A beautiful clear copper with a honey aroma and a certain dankness. The taste is tart, wheaty, honey and tart citrus. More approachable than Trebuchet but just as good.
Bottle. Nose os caramel, peaches, vinegar, grapefruit. Cloudy orange with lace. Flavor is honey, oranges, peaches, biscuits, some vinegar. Soft carbonation. Oily.
Tap at GABF. Pours a clear amber with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is floral, oak, toasted malt. Medium body, caramel, toasted malt, oak, nice sweetness, good.

500 ml bottle shared with prufrockstar and Beastiefan2k. Pours a hazy dark golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have pale toasted malts, bready, oak, lighter wine barrel character, spicy yeast, some citrus and leafy hops.

UPDATED: SEP 7, 2016 500-ml bottle from rare beer club. beautiful glowing hazy golden corn color, mini-gushed, sudsy white head, bits of lace, sour nose, lightly sour, hops, wine, fruit, some pepper bite, full body, surprising woody finish. Mourvèdre, not Sauvignon Blanc, variant.
Tap. Pours clear orange, small beige head, good lacing. Aroma is oak tannins, hints of butter, cherry, white wine, toffee. Flavor is light tart, oaky, a bit of fruit, lemon. Medium body. Quite nice.

GABf 2015. copper color. This is sour, and probably much too sour for a biere de garde. I do not get much more than the yeast and the sour flavor. I am not sure this was supposed to be so tart. Still not bad, but not like any biere de garde I can recall.
(En dégustation au Stone Sour Fest 2015): Vin et malts fruités dans lesquels on aurait déposé un bouquet de fines herbes contenant persil, thym et menthe sauvage.
At Cask Days 2014. Grape, apple tart, oak, funk, touch of pepper, dry finish. Nice mellow biere de garde.
On cask at cask days 2014. Total pickle experience. And good at that. Plain colour. Other spices in the background.vinegar character.

GABF 2014 
Mild aroma is tart and bready. Taste is tart, toasted malts and citrus  
Very good

Tap@ Ladyface. Clear copper color with ivory head. Spicy wine barrel, earthy malt, dry grassy aromas. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. Lightly tart, spicy wine barrel flavors with aged caramel, herbal, dry spices, dusty pale malts____drying finish----good.
user_location: Same Trailer, Different Park, Louisiana, USA

text: Draft pour at oakquinox 2014. Semi cloudy orange amber pour, with an off white head. Malty bread, some fruitiness, mild vinous, spice, oak, and notes of butter. This doesnt stand out to much.

[ Keg ][ Brewbies 2014 ][ 4oz ][ Brewbies Flared Mini Pint ][ Free ][ 3/1/14 ]
>> There are probably many versions of this beer all collapsed into this entry given their rarity/rarity of ratebeerians in general. This version was 7.1%, 100% Mourvedre Barrel Aged. Low haze orange pour. Nose is excellent buttery oak barrel, fresh bourbon more than red wine. Taste is clean, mild alcohol stickiness, candied orange, oak, paper. Tannic, pepper finish. Interesting as always from Ladyface but with the characteristic harsh palate that seems to be a universal problem with their beers.

Draft @the brewpub. Pours a pale amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy aroma with weak hints of yeast.Fruity malty spicy yeasty flavor. Has a fruity malty spicy yeasty finish.

Ladyface derailleur 2012 edition Feb 13 notes: Biere de grade aged w Chardonnay  Nice funky, lemon zest, white pepper. Flavor is tangerine, pear, apple, green grape, must. Actually quite nice. Boldly flavored but maintaining balance.
Medium-dark amber in color, slightly dry with undertones of mixed citrus, stone fruit and wild yeast.

On tap at the brewery. Poured a true gold. Crystal clear with minimal head. Big bubblegum nose and flavor with this one. Some fruitiness (apples, pears) too. Strong malt backbone. Much maltier than expected. I tried six of their beers that night, and this was easily my favorite. Well done.

Back log; from at least two years ago.  Havent had too many of this style, nice to see them brew this.  amber color with a whitish head.  Aroma was like a mild wine, with a nice uniqueness too it.  Light hopping.  Flavor had some apple, fruit and wine notes.  Some grain. A solid and enjoyable brew.

A hazy golden orange color with a white head.  Good fruitiness on the nose, mostly citrus, but a little bit of peach.  Grass, straw, and must give a soft funkiness.  A touch of oak, white wine, and lemon zest.  The flavor has a nice peach quality along with mild tartness of lemon.  Lots of straw, a moderate oak note along with some drying tannins.  A light malt flavor, mostly just bread.  The nose is a bit better than the flavor, but enjoyable.
Apricot colored pour with a white head.  Malty aroma with a very, very light hop finish.  Flavor is smooth, crisp, a bit dry with malt and some faint hops.  Easy to drink.

Aroma: fruity and quite vinous, bready yeast note, spicy hops, light pepper character, touch of booze.  Pours a slightly hazy light amber color, off-white head is lasting and leaves a nice coating of lacing.  Flavor: toasty malts, lots of wine notes, fruity esters, plums, some pepper and spice, earthy and a soft acidity, alcohol is noticeable but mellow.  Medium body and carbonation.  Very enjoyable brew.

Served on draft at local beer bar.  A cloudy look matches a somewhat thick palate.  Sour in taste, similar to same brewerys Trebuchet saison, but heavier on the mouth.  Taste of apple comes through as well.  Not my favorite style but well-done in that style.
Clear golden with a creamy white head. robust earthy grainy and clean citrus aroma and taste with a bright palate.
On tap sampler. Amber with an off white head. Very sweet, plum, lots of other fruit, bit of caramel and grains. Fresh, dry, some funk, some white wine notes.
Sampled at City Tavern with brewmaster Dave sitting next to me.  Kinda cool.  Pours a bright orange.  Crisp with a lingering flavor.  Nice light hoppy notes along with a touch of vanilla.

From the Jug at the GABF, Colorado Convention Center Denver 18/09/2010
Malt aroma. Clear golden coloured a little sweet on the palate and hoppy with a hint of dryness in a bitter malt finish.
(Draught)  Pours a clear yellow body with a moderate white head.  Aroma of citrus, florals, vinous, and grain.  Flavor of nuts, herbs, grass, orange, vinous, and caramel.
GABF 2010. Very good Biere de Garde. spice, pot pourri like purfuminess. Dash of sweet maltiness n this golden colored ale. Maybe a tad too sweet but still quite good in my book

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2010 My Bottom Line:
This dignified Bière de Garde joins lightly toasted malts, spicy noble hops and bready yeast into an authentic example of the style one rarely sees so far from French shores.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the hazy amber. 
-The hop signature also offers citrusy angles, ending in mildly leafy bitterness.
-Subtle oranges add complexity. 
-This example is polished and rustic at once, a true testament to this brewers ability. 

On tap at the brewpub.

On tap at Ladyface. Pours with a large white head that leaves good lace over a hazed gold to copper body. Aroma is dry, grainy, tannic, dry wine, light pepper. Taste is caramel, bread, light vinous and tannic wood. Lightly herbal. Great biere de garde. Lively bubbles, dry.

Oak aged version of the Tripel.  I liked this one much better - the wood dried out the syrupy sweetness and also calmed down some of the carbonation.  I actually enjoyed the dry hopped version even better that was also available when we were at the brewpub.

Draught at the restaurant watching the Tour de California.  Im not a big fan of Biere de Gardes but this was phenomenal; I think the wine barrels really made it special. It pours very still. A ruby-orange and brown colour with a small off-white head the quickly disappears/ The aroma is pink grapefruit, chardonnay and strawberries. Definitely fits the biere de garde style from the earthy, metallic notes (not bad, thats just my crutch for IDing the style). Definitely white wine notes that trend from a dry chardonnay to Mosel Rieslings. Lasting wine finish.
